--- In nbwrpg@y..., robertdahl <rdahl@t...> wrote:
> Beachcomber looked up from the hole, his smile fading. "Why do you 
say
> that?" He asked, curious of what Klant was refering to.
> 
> Firedrill kept studying the hole, it was so fascinating, and almost
> equivelant to underground hidings of the Neutrals on his planet in 
the
> past war.

::REDHOT::

    Redhot stirred at the two Autobot's conversation and for a momment 
it looked as though he would remain asleep. Instead he rose, very 
weary and wiped the sleep from his eyes.
    "The ground..is not..what I'm used to." he said, a smile 
broadening accross his face. "I'm used to a good..recharge..bed...some 
warm..energon....you know." He shrugged, hoping they would understand. 
He briefly surveyed the landscape around him, then returned his 
attention to the Autobots who hovered over something on the ground. 
The seeker scoweled, curious, and went to join them.
    He caughed as he crouched beside the hole.
    "Curious." he said, finally sounding more like his old self and 
not the wounded, broken worded weakling he appeared.
    "I've not seen tracks like these. What would they be?"

Northlight
Domnijoe Productions
